data.title: Island Records
data.meta_description: Since Chris Blackwell first started Island Records in Jamaica in 1959, it has remained one of the world’s most legendary record labels and a coveted destination for new and established artists across genres. data.text: Since Chris Blackwell first started Island Records in Jamaica in 1959, it has remained one of the world’s most legendary record labels and a coveted destination for new and established artists across genres. Today, Island is home to a varied roster across the US and UK. Its unique ethos has provided the platform for launching some of the biggest and most influential artists across the musical spectrum, including Bob Marley, U2, Grace Jones, Nick Drake, Cat Stevens and Amy Winehouse. In the UK, the roster includes Mumford & Sons, Hozier, Dermot Kennedy, The Last Dinner Party, and more while the Island US roster is home to artists such as Sabrina Carpenter, Shawn Mendes, Chappell Roan, Brittany Howard, Demi Lovato, Bon Jovi, Remi Wolf, Wyatt Flores, The Killers and more.
